intro: Randia montana, commonly known as mountain randia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a shrub that typically grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical and subtropical forests. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy. Randia montana is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in ecological studies and horticultural research.
